t: Job 32
Elihu Contradicts Job’s Friends
So*p these three men ceased answering Job, because he was*i righteous in his own eyes.
Then the wrath of Elihu, the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram, was aroused against Job; his wrath was aroused because he justified himself rather than God.
Also against his three friends his wrath was aroused, because they had found no answer, and yet*i had condemned Job.
Now*p because they were*i years older than he, Elihu had waited to speak to Job.
When Elihu saw that there*i was*i no answer in the mouth of these three men, his wrath was aroused.
So*p Elihu, the son of Barachel the Buzite, answered and said: “I*pn am*i young in years, and you are*i very old; Therefore*ld I was afraid, And*ld dared not declare my opinion to you.
I*ld said, ‘Age should speak, And*ld multitude of years should teach wisdom.’
But*ld there*i is*i a spirit in man, And*ld the breath of the Almighty gives him understanding.
Great*ld men are not always*i wise, Nor*ld do the aged always*i understand justice.
“Therefore*ln I say, ‘Listen to me, I*ld also will declare my opinion.’
Indeed*ld I waited for your words, I*ld listened to your reasonings, while you searched out what to say.
I*ld paid close attention to you; And*ld surely not one of you convinced Job, Or*ild answered his words—
Lest*ld you say, ‘We*ld have found wisdom’; God*ld will vanquish him, not man.
Now*ld he has not directed his*i words against me; So*ld I will not answer him with your words.
“They*ln are dismayed and answer no more; Words*ld escape them.
And*ld I have waited, because they did not speak, Because*ld they stood still and*i answered no more.
I*ld also will answer my part, I*ld too will declare my opinion.
For*ld I am full of words; The*ld spirit within me compels me.
Indeed*ld my belly is*i like wine that*i has no vent; It*ld is ready to burst like new wineskins.
I*ld will speak, that I may find relief; I*ld must open my lips and answer.
Let*ld me not, I pray, show partiality to anyone; Nor*ld let me flatter any man.
For*ld I do not know how to flatter, Else*ild my Maker would soon take me away.
